snippet: The Knicks allowed an average of 111.8 points during a four-game losing streak, in contrast to 89.7 points during a seven-game winning streak.
abstract: New York Knicks are expecting center Tyson Chandler's return from injury to help cure some of the defensive issues that, during their 0-4 record on the road, undid much of what they accomplished during their Jeremy Lin-fueled seven-game winning streak; Knicks will still be without forward Jared Jeffries, another key piece of their defensive foundation.
lead_paragraph: The Knicks allowed an average of 111.8 points during a four-game losing streak, in contrast to 89.7 points during a seven-game winning streak.

headline.seo: Chandler Expected to Return for Knicks
headline.main: Knicks View Chandler as Defense’s Partial Cure
headline.print_headline: Knicks View Chandler As Defense’s Partial Cure
